intro: Relhania passerinoides, commonly known as the yellow-stemmed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Viscaraceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has a woody stem with a yellowish hue and produces small, inconspicuous white or green flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a leathery texture. Relhania passerinoides relies on host trees for water and nutrients, while it provides nectar to attract pollinators like birds and insects.
